juzs.text: And said those who expect not for a meeting with Us: “Why not have been sent down unto us the angels or (that) we may see our Nourisher-Sustainer?" Surely, indeed they thought too highly of themselves and exceeded the limits to a transgression, monstrous
The Day they see the angels: no glad tidings this Day for the criminals. And they will say: “(Would there be) a barrier, completely barred (from allowing the process of Accountability to overtake us)
And We turned to the deeds they performed; then We crumbled it into pieces scattered (to the winds)
The inmates of Paradise, this Day are good in respect of an abode and better in respect of a place of rest
And (bring to mind) the Day when the heaven breaks up as clouds and the angels are sent down descending continuously
The Sovereignty this Day shall be real — exclusively for Ar-Rahman, and the Day is too hard for the disbelievers
And (bring to mind) the Day the transgressor will bite at his two hands (and) he will say: “Oh, would that I had picked up a path with the Messenger
Ah! Woe to me! Would that I had not taken so and so as a friend
Surely, indeed he led me astray from Az-Zikr after it had come to me. And the Satan, with respect to mankind, is a deserter in the hour of need.”
And the Messenger said: “O my Nourisher-Sustainer! Verily, my nation treated this Al-Quran as a discarded item.”
And thus did We make to every Prophet an enemy from among the sinners. And sufficient is your Nourisher-Sustainer as a Guide and Helper

And said those who have disbelieved: “Why not Al-Quran has been sent down to him all at one occasion? Like this, so that We may strengthen therewith your heart. And We have revealed it in small portions, slowly
And they do not confront you with a matter but We came to you with Truth and Ahsan-o-Tafseeran [‘A better commentary’ or ‘A better understanding’ (available within the Text of this Al-Kitab]
Those who will be gathered on their faces unto Hell — they (will be in) an evil place and more astray from (the right) path
And surely, indeed We delivered to Musa Al-Kitab, and appointed with him his brother Harun as a co-helper
Then We said: “Proceed you both to the nation of those who have rejected Ayaatina (‘Our Ayaat’). Then We destroyed them, an utter destruction
And the nation of Nuh — when they denied the Messengers We drowned them and We made them for mankind a Sign. And We have prepared a painful torment for the transgressors
And (also) ’Ad and Samud, and the dwellers of Ar-Rass, and many generations in between these (nations)
And all such nations We made as examples for it (i.e., a punishment that brought forward a complete annihilation of the civilization) and each one We destroyed, an utter destruction
And surely, indeed these have travelled through the town whereon was rained an evil rain. Have they not been that they may notice it? Nay! They had not been hoping for the resurrection (after death)
And when they saw you, they behave not with you except in jest and mockery, (saying): "Is this that whom Allah has sent as a Messenger

If he could, surely he will deviate us from our aaliha (gods), if not (it is) that we remained constant in (worshipping) them." And soon they will know when they see the torment, who is more astray from the (Right) Path
Have you seen, who has taken as his ilah his own vain desire? Would then you become, to him, a wakil
Or do you think that the majority of them do hear or understand? They are not but like cattle, Nay! They are farther away from the (Right) Path

Have you not pondered towards (the worhead of state of) your Nourisher-Sustainer how He has extended the shadow? And if He willed, surely He would make it still — then We have made the sun as a cause and effect over it
Then We withdrew this (shadow) to Us — a gradual silent withdrawal

And He it is Who made to you the night as a covering, and the sleep as a repose in tranquility; and He made the day as coming up into a new life [sleep is very similar to death, and rising from sleep is very similar to Resurrection]

And He it is Who sent the winds as heralds of glad tidings in between both the hands of His Mercy (i.e., just before the approaching rains). And We sent down from towards the sky — (rain-) water completely pure and clean —
so that We may revive thereby a dead land and We may give it as drink to that which We created as cattle and mankind in abundance
And indeed, We distributed it amongst them so that they may be reminded and remind others (about the Mercy of Allah) but the majority of mankind rejected except disbelief
And had We thought proper, We would have surely raised a Warner in every habitation
So obey not the disbelievers but strive hard with them with this (Al-Kitab) — (regarding it as) Jihadan Kabeeran (the greatest and supreme form of Jihad)

And He it is Who has meraja (merged) two seas, this palatable (and) sweet, and this salty (and) bitter; and He has set inbetween those two a barrier, and an obstruction, made completely obstructive (in allowing any intermixing of the two waters)

And He it is Who created a human being out of (a matter containing) water and has assigned to him blood-relationship and in-laws relationship. And your Nourisher-Sustainer is All-Capable (over anything)
And people worship besides Allah that which benefits them not and nor gives them (any) harm. And the disbeliever became one who intends to prevail against his (own) Nourisher-Sustainer
And We did not send you but as a bearer of glad tidings, as well as a warner
Declare: “I do not ask you, on this (propagation of the Message) any reward, except that whoever desired must pickup a path leading (him) to his Nourisher-Sustainer
And put the trust in the Ever Living One Who does not die and glorify (Him) with His praise. And Sufficient is He as the All-Knower of the sins of His Ibad —
Who created the heavens and the earth and whatever is in between those two in six aeons, then He set (Himself) over the Throne. Ar-Rahman: then ask about Him one who knows
And when it is said to them: “Prostrate to Ar-Rahman.” They said: “And what (do you mean by) Ar-Rahman? Shall we submit to that which you command us?” And this increased them in aversion
Blessed became He Who has set buruj in the heaven and has placed therein an emitting light and a moon that gives light
And He it is Who has set the night and the day constantly succeeding each other — for that who intended that he may be reminded and remind (others) or intended for (showing) gratitude

And the Ibad of Ar-Rahman are those who move on the earth in humility and sedateness; and when the ignorant (of the Divine Book) addressed them (with bad words or in jest and mockery), they replied in mild words of gentleness
And those who spend the night for (the Attention of and Mercy from) their Nourisher-Sustainer in a state of prostration and Qiyam (standing position while in Prayers)
And those who say: “Our Nourisher-Sustainer! Avert from us the torment of Hell. Truly, its torment is a lasting one which interrupts itself not
Surely, this (Hell) became evil as a place of rest and as an abode

And those when they spent, they did not indulge in extravagance and did not indulge in niggardliness and it (i.e., their attitude) stayed between these (two extremes) as something lasting and practicable

And those who do not invoke alongwith Allah another ilah, and they do not murder (or kill or slay) a Nafs whom Allah has forbidden (to be killed) — except under demand of justice; and they do not commit Zina. And whoever commits this he will face a most grievous sin
The punishment would be made more severe to him on the Day of Resurrection, and he will abide therein in disgrace —
except that who repented and accepted Faith and did righteous deeds, then those people: Allah will change their sinful deeds into good deeds. And Allah is (Ever) Oft-Forgiving, continuously Merciful
And whosoever repented and acted righteously, then certainly he: he takes a turn to Allah — a desirable turn
And those who do not give evidence (based) on falsehood, and when they passed by something indecent they passed on in grace and dignity
and those (who) when they are subjected to preaching with the help of Ayaat of their Nourisher-Sustainer, respond not to them as if they are deaf and blind
and those who say: “Our Nourisher-Sustainer! Grant us of our consorts and our children the delight of (our) eyes and make us Imam (model, leader or guide) for the righteous
Those people will be rewarded with a suite (in Paradise) because they showed patience and greeting and word of peace will be made to descend over them, therein —
(becoming) abiders therein. It became excellent as a place of rest and as an abode

Say: “What my Nourisher-Sustainer may care for you, if there is no invokation from you?" In such a case you have surely denied (His Majesty, Mercy and Grace). So (very) soon will appear the natural result (in the form of everlasting punishment). [If a person has Belief in Allah and His Capacities and His Attributes, he must invoke Him specially in periods of crisis and states of trouble — if he does not, he denies his own Belief in Him]
S. M
These (alphabets in the starting Verse are) signs of Al-Kitab-ul-Mobin (The Evident, Clear and Manifest Scripture)
Perhaps you are becoming one who keeps his Nafs (self) in grief and anxiety that the people do not revert as Believers (to the Book of Allah)
If We thought proper We could send unto them from the heaven a Sign so their necks instantly bent under its effect as (of) those who are in humility and submission
And there comes not to them Zikr (Message) from Ar-Rahman anew but they became unto it (as) those who keep themselves at a distance and do not attempt to listen, understand and adopt (Al-Kitab)
So indeed they have denied. So, very soon shall come the news of what they mock (at)
And have they not seen towards the earth how many We caused to grow therein out of all kinds of palatable (growths)
Verily, in this is surely Aayatan (a proof, sign or a lesson), yet most of them are not Believers
And verily, your Nourisher-Sustainer: truly He is the All-Mighty, the continuously Merciful
And (bring to mind) when your Nourisher-Sustainer called Musa (saying): “Proceed to the nation of transgressors —
the nation of Firaun. Will they not pay obedience (to Allah)?”
(Musa) said: “My Nourisher-Sustainer! Verily, I fear that they will belie me
and my chest constricts and my tongue does not speak fluently. So send (Your Inspirations) to Harun (to accompany me as a Messenger)
And they have a charge of crime against me, whereof I fear that they will kill me.”
(Allah) said: “Certainly never! Go you both with Ayaatina (Our Signs). Verily, We shall be with you (as) Listeners
Then proceed both of you to Firaun, then both of you say: ‘Surely, we are 'Messenger from the Nourisher-Sustainer of the worlds
that you send Bani Israiel with us (as a free people desiring to emigrate)
(Firaun) said: “Did we not bring you up among us as a child? And you did stay many years of your life with us
And you did your deed, which you did. And you are of the ungrateful.”
(Musa) said: “I did it while: and I (was) of the ignorants (— not fully conversant with the Divine Message)

So I fled from you when I feared you. Then my Nourisher-Sustainer bestowed me Hukman (‘Verdict, Order or Ordainment’. This is an attribute for Allah’s Book) and appointed me (as one) of the Messengers
And this is the favour for which you taunt me — that you have kept Bani Israiel in bondage?”
Firaun said: “And what (is meant by the term) Rabb-ul-Alamin?”
(Musa) said: “Nourisher-Sustainer to the heavens and the earth and whatever is between those two — if you be those who become convinced.”
(Firaun) said to those around him: “Do you not hear?”
(Musa further) said: “Nourisher-Sustainer to you people, and Nourisher-Sustainer to your initial fathers (who initiated your dynasty)!”
(Firaun) said: “Surely your Messenger who has been sent to you indeed (appears to be) a fanatic
(Musa continued and) said: “Nourisher-Sustainer for the east and the west and whatever is between those two if you had been using intellect.”
(Firaun) said: “Surely, if you chose an ilah (god) other than me, I will certainly make you out of those who are put to prison.”
(Musa) said: “What? Even if I approached you with something manifest?”
(Firaun) said: “Then come along with it if you are of the truthful.”
So (Musa) kept his rod on the ground, so, instantly it (is) a serpent, manifest
And he drew out his hand, so, instantly it (is) completely white for the beholders
(Firaun) said to the chiefs around him: “Verily, this (is) indeed a well-versed magician
He intends that he may expel you from your land through his sorcery, then what it is that you advise (for orders)?”
They said: “Put him off and his brother (for a while), and send callers for the cities
They shall return to you with all the expert sorcerers.”
So the magicians were made to assemble at a fixed time on the well-known day
And it was said to the people: “Are you (too) going to assemble
Perchance we may follow the sorcerers if they became: they (very ones) as winners?”
So when the magicians arrived, they said to Firaun: “Will surely there be for us a certain reward if we became — we (as) the winners?”
He said: “Yes (of course), and verily you shall then, surely be of those who have been delegated nearness (to my person).”
Musa said to them: “Throw (on the ground) what you intend to throw.”
So they threw their ropes and their rods, and said “By the might of Firaun, certainly we — surely, we (will be) the winners
Then Musa dropped his rod, so instantly it swallows all the falsehood which they indulge in
So the sorcerers were made to drop (themselves on the ground as) those who are prostrating (in humility to Allah)
They said: “We have developed Faith in the Nourisher-Sustainer of the worlds —
Nourisher-Sustainer of Musa and Harun!”

(Firaun) said: “You have Believed for his sake prior to that I give you permission. Surely, he indeed is your senior-most who has taught you magic. So surely, soon you will come to know. Without doubt, I will chop off your hands and your legs on opposite sides, and surely I will crucify you all.”
(The magicians who were now sincere and devoted Muslims) said: “No harm (it does to us). Surely we are those who return to our Nourisher-Sustainer
Surely, we desire exceedingly that Our Nourisher-Sustainer may forgive for us our sins as we become the first Believers (out of the nation of Firaun).”
And We sent inspiration to Musa that: “Move away (emigrate) with My Ibad, surely you are those who are being chased.”
So Firaun sent callers in all the cities
(Saying): “Verily, these indeed are a minority — a very small band of people
And verily, they have acted with us, surely as those who enrage (us)
And verily, we indeed are a multitude (i.e., a great nation) fully vigilant.”
So, We expelled them from orchards and streams
and treasures and position of honour
Thus (it all happened) and We gave it (all) in inheritance to Bani Israiel
So they pursued them as those who were witnessing the sunrise
So when the two groups see (each other) the companions of Musa said: “Surely, we are indeed those who have been traced (by the persecuting enemy)
(Musa) said: “Certainly never! Certainly, with me is my Nourisher-Sustainer, soon He guides me.”
So We sent inspiration to Musa (saying) that: "Strike with your rod (on) the sea.” Instantly it parted and each separate part (of the sea-water) became like a firm mass, extremely huge
And We made the others come at that very site
And We saved Musa and whoever was with him — all together
Then (then and there) We drowned the others
Verily, in this is indeed a sign, yet most of them are not Believers
And verily, your Nourisher-Sustainer: truly He is the All-Mighty, the continuously Merciful
And rehearse unto them the information about Ibrahim
When he said to his father and his nation: “What is it that you worship?”
They said: “We worship idols and we remain confined in retreat (to them)
(Ibrahim) said: “Do they hear you when you call (or invoke them)
Or they give you benefit or they give (you) harm?”
They said: “Nay, we found our fathers- like this they do.”
He said: “Have you then (ever) observed that which you have been worshipping —
you and your ancient fathers
So, surely, they are enemies to me, except the Nourisher-Sustainer to the worlds
That Who has created me, then He (also) guides me
And That Who: He feeds me and gives me to drink (palatable water and other liquids)
And when I fell sick, then He cures me
And That Who will cause me to die, (and) afterwards shall revive me
And That, Who: I exceedingly desire that He forgives me my faults on the Day of Accountability.”
My Nourisher-Sustainer! Bestow on me decisive power and join me with the righteous
And grant me a truthful tongue (an honest reporting) among later generations
And make me among the inheritors of the Garden of Delight
And grant forgiveness for my father, surely he is of the erring ones
And disgrace me not when (all) are resurrected —
the Day when does not benefit the wealth, and nor sons
except that who came to Allah with a heart in complete submission
And the Paradise has been brought closest to the righteous
And the Hell-Fire is brought to full view of the erring people
And it is said to them: “Where (have gone) those whom you used to worship —
besides Allah? Do they provide you help or provide assistance to themselves in retaliation (to Allah’s decision)?”
Then they were thrown on their faces into this (Fire) — they (who encouraged their own worship) and (all) the erring ones
and the groups of Iblis — altogether
They said while they therein indulge in arguments
By Allah! When we had been surely in manifest error
when we hold you as equal with the Nourisher-Sustainer of the worlds
and did not deviate us except Al-Mujrimun
So there are not for us out of the intercessors
nor a devoted friend
Then if there could be for us one chance of return to the worldly life, then we will (definitely) become out of those who Believe.”
Verily, in this is indeed a sign, yet most of them are not Believers
And verily, your Nourisher-Sustainer: truly, He is the All-Mighty, the continuously Merciful
The nation of Nuh belied the Messengers
when their brother Nuh said to them: “Will you not pay obedience (to Allah)
Certainly, I am to you a trustworthy Messenger
So pay obedience to Allah and obey me
And I do not ask you for this any reward. My reward is not due except with the Nourisher-Sustainer to the worlds
So pay obedience to Allah and obey me
They said: “Shall we Believe for your sake while (only) those who belong to the lower-strata of society have followed you?”
He said: “And what is my knowledge about what they used to do
Their accountability is not (the responsibility) except of my Nourisher-Sustainer if you do understand
And I am not that who drives away the Believers
I am not but a plain warner
They said: “Truly, if you do not stop (your way of propagating and preaching), O Nuh! You will surely be of those who have been rejected and expelled.”
He said: “My Nourisher-Sustainer! Verily, my nation has belied me
Therefore pronounce You, between me and between them judgement and rescue me and whosoever is with me out of the Believers.”
So We saved him and those with him in the fully loaded Ark
Then We drowned thereafter, the rest
Verily, in this is indeed a sign, yet most of them are not Believers
And verily, your Nourisher-Sustainer: truly, He is the All-Mighty, the continuously Merciful
’Ad (people) belied the Messengers
when their brother Hud said to them: “Will you not pay obedience (to Allah)
Verily, I am to you a trustworthy Messenger
So pay obedience to Allah and obey me
And I do not ask you for this any reward. My reward is not due except with the Nourisher-Sustainer to the worlds
Do you build on every prominent place a monument? You act uselessly (seehead of state vain glory)
And you establish industrial units as if you will stay (in the world) permanently
And when you persecuted you persecuted as tyrants
So pay obedience to Allah and obey me
And pay obedience to Him Who has helped you through that which you (very well) know
He has helped you with cattle and children
and gardens and springs
Verily, I fear against you a torment of a Great Day
They said: “It is same to us whether you gave (us) a sermon or be not of those who give sermons
This (counselling which you have uttered before us is) nothing but the practices of the initial people
And we will not become those who have been punished
So they belied him, then We destroyed them. Verily, in this is indeed a sign, yet most of them are not Believers
And verily, your Nourisher-Sustainer: truly He is the All-Mighty, the continuously Merciful
Samud (people) belied the Messengers
when their brother Salih said to them: “Will you not pay obedience (to Allah)
Verily, I am to you a trustworthy Messenger
So pay obedience to Allah and obey me
And I do not ask you for this, any reward. My reward is not due except with the Nourisher-Sustainer to the worlds
Will you be left in whatever (is available) over here as a people who have obtained complete security —
in gardens and springs
and corn-fields and date-palm — its spathe (or spadix) a soft one, ready to split open
And you carve inside the mountains — houses, as highly skilled people
So pay obedience to Allah and obey me
And obey not the order of Al-Musrifun —
those who make mischief on the land and reform not
They said: “Surely what (is a fact is that) you are of those who are under effect of magic
You are not but (just) a human being like us. Then come (to us) with a credential (or miracle) if you happen to be out of those who speak the truth
(Salih) said: “This is a she-camel. For her (must be a right) to drink (water) and for you (likewise is a right) to drink (water) on the day (specified and made) wellknown
And touch her not with (any) harm, otherwise torment of a Great Day shall seize you
But they hamstrung her (compelling her to limp), then they became regretful —
so the torment overtook them. Verily, in this is indeed a sign, yet most of them are not Believers
And verily, your Nourisher-Sustainer: truly He is the All-Mighty, the continuously Merciful
The nation of Lout belied the Messengers —
when their brother Lout said to them: “Will you not pay obedience (to Allah)
Verily, I am unto you a trustworthy Messenger
So pay obedience (to Allah) and obey me
And I do not ask you for this any reward. My reward is not due except with the Nourisher-Sustainer to the worlds
Do you approach males (to satisfy your appetite) out of (the people in) the worlds
and you avoid what your Nourisher-Sustainer has created for you, out of your (female) consorts? Nay, you are a nation who trespass and transgress
They said: “If you do not desist (from your sermons and counsellings) O Lout, surely you become of those who have been expelled (and banished from the land)
(Lout) said: “Without a speck of doubt I am of those who have a feeling of hate and detestation against your act (of homosexuality)
My Nourisher-Sustainer! Save me and my family members and followers from what the people do
So We saved him and his family, all (of them) —
except an old woman, (We left her) in those who were to be covered under the dust and debris (of the torment)
Afterwards We completely destroyed the others
And We rained on them a rain (of torment). Then evil became the rain to those who were warned (in advance)
Verily, in this is indeed a sign, yet most of them are not Believers
And verily, your Nourisher-Sustainer: truly He is the All-Mighty, the continuously Merciful
The dwellers of Al-’Aiyka belied the Messengers
when Shuaib said to them: “Will you not pay obedience (to Allah)
Surely, I am, unto you, a trustworthy Messenger
So pay obedience to Allah and obey me
And I do not ask you for this, any reward. My reward is not due except with the Nourisher-Sustainer to the worlds
Complete the measure or weight and be not of those who give less
And weigh with a balance which (deceives not and) maintains its balance
And defraud not people in their items (regarding number, quality, measure or weight etc.) and behave not in the land as disruptionists or as corrupt people
And obey That Who created you and the generations of the earlier people
They said: “ Certainly what (is a fact is that) you are of those who are under effect of sorcery
And you are not but a human being like us, and surely, we regard you definitely of those who are liars
So cause a piece (of some rock) to descend on us from the direction of the sky (to destroy us) if you are of the truthful.”
(Shuaib) said: “My Nourisher-Sustainer knows better what you people do (and what you deserve in punishment).”
So they belied him, then the torment seized them in the day of over-shadowing gloom. Indeed, it was a punishment of a dreadful day
Verily, in this is indeed a sign, yet most of them are not Believers
And verily, your Nourisher-Sustainer: truly He is the All-Mighty, the continuously Merciful
And truly, this (Al-Kitab) is surely a Descent from the Nourisher-Sustainer of the worlds
Descended with it Ar-Ruh-ul-Amin (The Trustworthy Spirit)
to your heart so that you become of the warners
in the clearly evident Arabic tongue
And surely, this (Al-Kitab) is indeed in the Zubur [this is plural of Zabur and it means sheets (of written material)] of the earlier people
And is it not a sign to them that the learned people of Bani Israiel are conversant with it
And if We had made it to descend unto some of those whose mother tongue is not Arabic
then he had read it unto them, they would not have become Believers thereto
Thus have We caused it (disbelief in Al-Kitab) to enter into the hearts of the sinful
they will not Believe in it until they see the painful torment
So it shall approach them all of a sudden while they will not perceive (it)
So they will say: “Will we become those who are granted some respite?”
Do they then wish to be hastened on regarding punishment to proceed from Us
Have you marked? If We provided them provisions for years
after that, reached them what they had been promised
whatever they were being provided as provisions did not benefit them (at all)
And We did not destroy a township but for it (were sent) warners —
by way of reminder, and We are not unjust
And did not descend with it (i.e., for bringing down Al-Kitab) the devils
And it does not (even) suit them, and they have no capacity (to do this job)
Verily, they are indeed those who stand deprived from even listening (to it)
So invoke not alongwith Allah another ilah (god) lest you be among those who have been subjected to punishment
And warn your tribe, nearest kinsmen
And lower your wing (in mercy and forgiveness) for that who has followed you out of the Believers
Then if they disobeyed you, then say: “Surely, I am absolved of what you practice.”
And put your trust in the All-Mighty, the continuously Merciful
Who marks you when you stand up (to lead the Prayers)
and your changing postures among the Submitters
Verily! He, only He, is the All-Hearer, the All-Knower
Shall I inform you upon whom descend the devils
They descend on all those who are frequent liars, (and) continuous sinners
They transmit (without getting confirmed) what is heard and most of them are untrue in speech
As for the poets, (only) the erring ones follow them
have you not seen that they roam about in all the (imaginary) valleys (of thought)
And that they utter what they do not practice

except those who have accepted Faith, and have performed righteous deeds and have glorified and propagated Allah exceedingly, and have done an effective rebut after they were made to face injustice. And soon will know those who have indulged in injustice as to what place of return they shall return. [The poets, writers, thinkers and historians indulge in injustice and need an effective rebuttal when they direct their onslaughts against Allah, Islam, Messengers, Islamic state and the ordainments and directives available in Al-Kitab]
S. These (alphabets in this verse are) signs of Al-Quran and Kitab-un-Mobin
Hudah, and Bushrah for the Believers
those who establish As-Salat, and pay-up Az-Zakat, and they, regarding the Hereafter — they feel certainty
Verily, those who do not Believe in the Hereafter, We have made their deeds (appear) fair-seeming to them, so they wander about blindly
They are those: for them is an evil torment. And they, in the Hereafter: they become the greatest losers
And verily you: indeed, you are being bestowed Al-Quran from the Presence of All-Wise, All-Knowing

(Bring to mind) when Musa said to his family: “Verily, I have noticed a fire, soon I will approach you therefrom with some information or I come to you with a burning brand so that you may warm yourself.”
So when he came to it he was called that: “Blessed has been made that whosoever is in the ‘fire’, and who is in its precincts. And glorified be Allah, the Nourisher-Sustainer to the worlds
O Musa! Verily, it is I, Allah, the All-Mighty, the All-Wise

And put you down your rod!" But when he marked it (that) it moves, as if it (is) a snake, he turned being one who turns his back and did not return. (It was said): “O Musa! Fear not. Verily, the Messengers fear not in My Presence
except that who has done wrong, (and) afterwards has brought in replacement good after evil; then surely, I am Oft-Forgiving, continuously Merciful
And put your hand into your bosom, it will come forth white without any disease. (These are) among the nine credentials to Firaun and his nation. Surely, they are a nation of those who are Fasiqun
So when Our enlightening Credentials came to them, they said: “This is manifest magic.”
And they insulted and mocked these (credentials) — although their ownselves did get influenced by these — wrongfully and arrogantly. So see what was the end of the Mufsidun
And surely, indeed We bestowed knowledge to Daud and Sulaiman, and they both said: “Selective Praise suits Allah (Alone) Who has preferred us in rank above many of His Believing Ibad.”

And Sulaiman inherited (the possessions and qualities of) Daud. And he said: “O mankind! We have been taught the language of the birds, and we have been bestowed from all things. Surely, this indeed: it is the evident grace
And there were made to assemble, before Sulaiman, his regiments of jinns, and humans, and birds. So they are set in groups (ready to move) —
until when they entered unto the valley of the ants, one she-ant said: “O you ants! Enter your dwellings, lest Sulaiman and his regiments crush you, while they perceive not.”

So (Sulaiman) smiled, (becoming) one who laughs at her utterance and said: “My Nourisher-Sustainer! Grant me (the initiative and desire) that I may pay thanks for Your Grace that You have showered upon me and upon my parents, and that I may do righteous good deeds with which You may agree, and admit me under cover of Your Mercy, among your righteous Ibad
And (Sulaiman) made the (military) review of the (regiments of the) birds, and said: “What is (gone wrong) with me that I do not see the hoopoe? Or is he among the absentees
I will surely punish him with a severe punishment, or I will surely slaughter him, or he must return to me with some convincing reasoning.”

But (the hoopoe) tarried not long. So (he came back and) said: “I have surveyed what you survey not thereof. And I have returned to you from (the head of statedom of) Saba with an authentic information
Certainly I found a woman; she rules over them, and she has been bestowed with all sorts of things (which a ruler may possess) and to her is a gorgeous throne
I found her and her nation: they prostrate to the sun instead of Allah, and Satan has made their deeds fair-seeming to them, and has barred them from the (Right) way, so they receive not the guidance
(and) that they do not prostrate to Allah Who brings to light what is hidden in the heavens and the earth and Knows what you conceal and what you reveal
Allah! La-ilaha-illa-Huwa, the Nourisher-Sustainer to the Supreme Throne!”
(Sulaiman) said: “Soon We shall see whether you spoke the truth or you are out of those who misquote
Go you, with this Kitab (Book) of mine, and deliver it to them; then withdraw from them and see what is that response with which they return (to me)
(The female ruler) said: “O you chiefs! Verily, me — has been delivered to me, unto me Kitab-un-Kareem (a Noble Book)
Verily, it is from Sulaiman, and verily it (takes a start thus): With the name of Allah — the Bestower of unlimited mercy, the continuously Merciful
(and) that: 'Be you not exalted against me and come to me as Muslims.' ”
She said: “O you chiefs! Advise me in (this) case of mine. I am not a lady who takes decision until you are present with me (to give your assent).”
They said: “We are possessors of (great) might and possessors of (capacity for) intense war, but the decision lies with you; so think over what is that which you will command.”
She said: “Verily, the sovereign rulers, when they entered any habitation, they despoiled it and made the more honourable of its citizens as the more disgraced ones, and thus they will do
And verily, I am going to send them (my men) with a present, then (I will be) one who will watch and see with what the messengers return.”

So when (the messengers with the royal gift) came to Sulaiman, he said: “Will you provide me aid and assistance in the form of wealth and provisions? So, what Allah has given me is better than what He has given you. Nay, you rejoice in your gift

Go back to them. Then verily, we shall come to them with (military) forces — there is no capacity with them (i.e., with the forces of Saba) for (facing) these (Muslim regiments). And we shall surely drive them out from this (land of Saba) in disgrace, and they (will be) those who have surrendered.”
(Sulaiman now addressed the chiefs in his state and) said: “O you chiefs! Which of you comes to me with her throne prior to that they may come to me as Muslims?”
An Ifrit (strong one) from the jinns said: “I will come to you with that before you rise from your sitting. And verily, I am, for this, indeed strong and trustworthy.”

Said that with whom was knowledge from Al-Kitab : “I will come to you with it even earlier than ' the margin of your eyelid returns to you' (i.e., within the twinkling of an eye)." So when he saw it placed before him, he said: "This is by the Grace of my Nourisher-Sustainer so that He may test me whether I become grateful or I become ungrateful. And whoever pays thanks (to Allah, it is) for his own self, and whoever became ungrateful — then certainly my Nourisher-Sustainer is Free of all wants, Bountiful.”

(Sulaiman) said: “Disguise and transform in her interest, her throne (by removing all signs and engravings that depict polytheism or disbelief). We shall see whether she receives guidance or she becomes of those who do not receive guidance.”

So when she came, it was said (to her): " Is this like your throne?” She said: “As though it is that very one. And Al-Ilm (‘The Knowledge’) has been delivered to us even before this and we have become Muslims.”
And (Sulaiman’s effort) stopped her from that which she used to worship besides Allah. Surely, she used to be of a nation of disbelievers

It was said to her: “Enter the palace.” But as she saw it, she assessed it to be a wide expanse of water running in waves and she tucked up (her clothes) off her both calves (so that she may cross it over gracefully). (Sulaiman) said: “Truly, it is a palace (underneath which runs a river, simulating the delights in Paradise) paved smooth with slab of crystal-clear glass. She said: “My Nourisher-Sustainer! Verily, I have wronged myself and I have accepted Islam in the presence of Sulaiman in complete devotion to Allah, the Nourisher-Sustainer to the worlds.”
And surely, indeed We sent to Samud (people) their brother Salih, (saying) that: “Pay obedience to Allah.” Then when they (broke up into) two sects, they quarrel among each other
He said: “O my nation! Why do you hasten in evil before good? Why don’t you ask Allah for forgiveness so that you: you may be showered mercy
They said: “We augured ill omen from you and whoever is with you.” He said: “Your (belief about) ill omen is (under record) with Allah; nay, you are a people put under test and trial.”
And there were in the city nine bands of men: they create mischief in the land and do not indulge in (any) reform

They said : " Swear one to another by Allah that we shall make a secret night attack on him and his household; afterwards we will surely say to his heir-attorney: ‘We witnessed not the slaying place of his household and verily, we are surely those who tell the truth
And they devised a plot and We planned an stratagem while they perceive (it) not
Then see how was the final end of their plot — that We destroyed them and their nation, all together
So these are their houses in utter ruin as they transgressed. Surely, in this is indeed a lesson for a nation who know
And We rescued those who Believed and used to obey (Allah)
And (bring to mind) Lout when he said to his nation: “Do you indulge in Al-Fahisha while you see (the evil aspect thereof)
Is it (that) surely you people indeed approach men in sexual lust instead of women? Nay, you are a nation: you behave senselessly
